IroA7LhQ28mAo1GjWwyygA.text: Waited sitting for 20min without being served until I decided to stand up and leave. They are either disrespectful or disorganized to let people wait that long.

G8ty8OiBnOtD4ziv712hbA.text: I haven't had sushi this good since I lived in St.  Croix and was eating that day's local catch. It's by far the best I've had since moving back to Charlotte. I would particularly recommend the Kiss of Fire roll--it isn't as spicy as I hoped, but the flavor is amazing. I was trying to cut back on eating out, and then this opened in my neighborhood-- I'm in trouble!

7azPwkh171mazItuKRwspQ.text: Great Food - Great Cocktails And GREAT Service!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! Sit at the bar & Gus will create your new favorite drink!

2RhqNY8jX4DRSFoClJ_7xQ.text: I've been here twice now and each experience was delightful.  Yamazaru is tucked away behind an apartment community. The ambience is nice and cozy.  Gus was the bartender on both nights that I visited. He's friendly and helped with recommendations on food and specialty cocktails. He's an awesome bartender.  They also make their syrups in house.  The sushi is good and fresh!  I also had their crab cake puppy or shall I say puppies because you get three. They were amazing!!  The beef tataki is also good.  I'm not usually a fan of rare meat, but this dish was very flavorful didn't even bother me that the meat was lightly seared.  Great place for after work cocktails and sushi or a date night.

DdNSy4IP81J_fhq606V6LQ.text: Went here on a Friday night and the place was super busy, so we decided to sit out on the "patio". I put that in quotes because it is more like the sidewalk in front of the door with 5 hightop tables. The inside was very nice, and pretty cool setup for a sushi bar.   When other people were out on the patio getting water/drinks or food we got the shaft. Had to wait for over 15 minutes for water to brought out to the table. Then another 15 minutes to get our drinks. Our waiter took our order and was off, didn't see him again for about 45 minutes. At this point I started to get worried that he got lost, not to mention everyone was now gone from the "patio" so we were just hanging out on the "patio" without anymore water, with empty drinks, no food, and no music of any kind out on the "patio" just silence...cotton mouthed silence...  We did get our appetizer about an hour after we placed our order. We ordered the cream cheese dip, but it wasn't exactly what we thought it would be. Turns out cream cheese dip is actually 5 crab rangoon. Not sure why they would call it a dip, but hey it's their restaurant they can call it whatever they would like.   Our food came out about 30 mins after the appetizer. I was not blown away by the rolls, but they weren't bad.   Considering we didn't order anything that was cooked (besides our "dip") I feel like the service was a tad on the slow side (note the sarcasm). Not to mention, the waiter told my wife when she asked for more water "you need to be patient". Now he said it not in a pleasant it might be a moment kind of way, it came off in more of a hold your damn horses kind of way.  From being seated to eating and getting the check took well over 2 hours.  Overall I think this place could be cool, prices are about the same as other sushi places in the area, maybe a dollar or two cheaper. I would say don't sit out on the "patio" dine inside, and hopefully you will get better service, but if you got two and a half hours to kill, give the "patio" a shot.  Don't think I will be returning.

1u64Eov6179dMbRGSpm_5Q.text: I agree with Matt F--service was slow and just so-so. Drinks were good-loved the stoli doli martini, but the transfusion's ingredients sounded good individually but the drink didn't come together. Really enjoyed salmon tacos and lettuce wraps (not enough filling for the lettuce). We had a sample of the homemade ginger beer which was really good. Overall, we were disappointed in the sushi, especially specialty rolls, which were either small in size (south end roll) and/or too much rice and little filling. Atmosphere was ok--our entire party felt Oku is much better in all areas.

zSxikgC6E5_iY6Njc9kZow.text: Awesome service by all.  I sat at the bar and the gentleman behind the bar was great.   Chicken fried rice is good with a nice blend. Highly recommend the Volcano roll and the steamed dumplings were also very tasty.

nVHY88hREQshOCOKRHlg-A.text: Great quality sushi, nice atmosphere. Had to wait a little for a table but once we sat, we had a wonderful experience. TONS of sushi rolls and apps

W02gKqk-Ri4BkvxTFsQgFg.text: The quality was great! Our waiter was also awesome. He knew what kind of fish I wanted and was helpful. The pricing was the best part. Less expensive then other places but the sushi was amazing. My new favorite sushi spot!!

XFdLo7Qk9ZAsgWj5zVh1FA.text: Oh my god: reasonable prices and best sushi ever. Get there early or expect a short wait.... which is well worth it!!

djbxcHR8WYZw2aQCGQRVJQ.text: This is seriously the best sushi I've had in Charlotte. I've tried about every place in the area and I can say that hands-down they have the best quality fish in the area. If you're a sushi purist, and you want good fish that melts in your mouth, THIS IS WHERE YOU NEED TO GO!! Not to mention they have great appetizers, tempura, and donburi. I can't wait to make my way through the entire menu!

1aQgNzWicYubezS-H1gn9Q.text: The best sushi in town :) fish is always fresh, prices are great and service is awesome!

-zZb0Oh0xXV83GLYRg7byQ.text: Amazing sushi place! One of the better ones in Charlotte, especially for the price. I had the tuna fresh summer rolls and they were awesome! At only $4 per roll, I felt this was a great deal for so much fresh ahi tuna. I got the mango de tango roll and the rich and famous roll, both were delicious! The specialty rolls were a good size and under $10 a roll for the two I got. Their drinks also looked unique and sounded great, I will be trying a few of them next time. Overall, I had a great experience here and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna fresh summer roll (middle), rich and famous roll (front), mango de tango rolls (back)

njup7r6jaPUJG-OqxZrvnA.text: Great place for Sushi and other Asian food. The sushi here is outstanding, with a great selection of rolls available. Very nice drink and beer menu, and the service is also top notch. Has been very consistent as well. Enjoy!

ksf8hQwaGsuVcoCdniysuw.text: Love Yamazaru!  Great sushi for the whole family! The staff is friendly and efficient. The sushi is super yummy! And they have a full bar.  Love the intimate atmosphere with exposed brick, wood, and metal accents.  Well done!

iJJZdtVtQ6PVGqrYoNYbbg.text: I am not a sushi lover, but I could eat here any night. Brought my sushi loving husband here for his birthday and everything we ordered exceeded expectations-- great food, service, atmosphere.

40MEKRIdONk3LKM_MVZwzQ.text: Yamazaru is the best kept secret in Charlotte! It has delicious sushi and an awesome atmosphere. And their moscow mule is made with homemade ginger beer!

jmPnPrwvlbJDs81f1pDrbg.text: Nice..better than advertised. Love the low key atmosphere. Tuna tasted very fresh and Brussels sprouts were exceptional.

Wh1at0cjAfYcGz6Hi5ACEw.text: I've only sat at the bar the few times I've come and the service was great. Gus's drinks were even better. He makes a mean dirty martini. And the sushi is to die for... fresh, flavorful and original. It's a little hidden gem.

3l6cSHnZEP54XFZuzaj3SQ.text: This. Place. Is. So. Good. We showed up with a party of 14 and they were so kind and accommodating. Gus the bartender made us THE BEST DRINKS EVER. Ask for Gus when you stop in to the bar. I'll absolutely be back.

q3oTjsg5tWAnv_TH71Wp2A.text: Yamazaru is the absolute best! It is a long overdue sushi (& more) establishment added to the Southend restaurant scene. I am an absolute 'sushi snob' who moved here from Chicago. The sushi grade, food quality, personal service and affordable prices make this restaurant stand out from all the rest. Gus, the bartender, is incredible! He's so attentive and makes the most amazing drinks. If you haven't tried his custom creation of ginger beer (used in many of the cocktails), ask for a sample! It will blow you away- so fresh, authentic and with a kick.  Hata-San is (to my understanding) the mastermind and guru behind the whole restaurant's concept. A True master of his craft and frequently found behind the bar &/or greeting customers. The food: Every recommendation from the staff is spot-on. Even if you're not a sushi (raw food) fan, there are plenty of menu options to enjoy. I personally like sashimi and nigiri. The fish selections literally melt in your mouth. As a self proclaimed 'sushi snob', I rate this place as an A+. Not to mention, the prices are so reasonable and not pretentious.  If you're looking for a place for a special night out or a regular neighborhood spot, I highly recommend Yamazaru!

HBU-NtYAAFg50d0-HXhNqA.text: Came with a few friends and didn't mind waiting a while for a table. The manager was so sweet and bought us drinks while we wait! Staff is super friendly and the food was great! The New Moon roll is probably my favorite. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. Can't wait to come back (:

TXHWpNOtfyNkr0uUfvf_cw.text: Great food. Great service. I recommend the crispy brussel sprouts and the Westwood's sushi roll.

ZNRtqHYaE5csjqZYM4g5MQ.text: Go to sushi place in Charlotte. Delicious sushi for a fair price. Don't even bother with anything else on the menu. Go straight for the sushi!!!!

fQKPdIl7cTGneE-Dd3jMvQ.text: We checked out Yelp and the reviews were good.  Cautiously, we decided to try it out.  We needed a good Sushi "go to" place and this location was totally spot on.   Always sit. At the bar.. first thing, both bartenders came up and shook our hands introducing themselves.   (Good move).  Service was totally great.  Food also proved excellent.  Diverse menu with a TON of traditional and creative sushi items as well as other traditional and non traditional Asian cuisine.    We had our normal wine and Titos and Soda, but they had an impressive custom drink menu (fresh juices etc...) and a respectable beer and wine list.   Quality was exceptional.  Price was not outrageous and the service was top notch.   We found our new go to place!

zyAHWomt-7aWrbIQHqLybA.text: Really delicious sushi here and reasonable prices. They charge a 10% fee when you do takeout. Super busy all the time and can be hard to find parking.

rGWr5ELGloRjhghqVFxSdg.text: Sushi was delicious and the drinks were great! The sushi tasted fresh and came out quickly. The drinks were strong. The salmon lover was my favorite for sure. My only complaint is the space is very small. It is definitely not meant for big groups.Perfect for a date night!

Ipwn_mPtsQIKgAjmtrRRlQ.text: Best sushi in Charlotte so far and there is free parking in the back.  Make a reservation ahead of time because this place gets pack. Prices on food is affordable.

ZUxjCz8V_5ARNtu17Lm1Iw.text: I came here between 6 and 7 pm on a Friday night, and we took one of the few unreserved tables before everything filled up and quite a few parties were turned away.  My husband and I wish we could have returned multiple times; the rolls are riotously cheap!-an average of $10/specialty roll, and these weren't wimpy, cheap rolls, either!  We ordered the: - Lychee Martini @ $10 - additional lychee sake would have added to the flavor, but it was a great blend and perfect for a breezy night outside - Green Dragon Roll @ $10  - UFO Roll @ $10 - Volcano Roll @ $8  All of the rolls were absolutely delicious! We certainly did not expect such a fantastic sushi restaurant in NC, but wow!-they didn't disappoint. I especially loved the Volcano Roll with its perfect mix of crab salad and green onion.   10/10 would go again, so boohoo that we live in Dallas.

4CQSueYc0dOj7eNsCVBFmg.text: My first time here and I think the food is not bad. It's definitely different (since I'm from CA), but for the price and quality, I think it's a good spot if you're craving for some sushi. Overall, decent sushi spot and pretty affordable.

CWFlxBeGIVb2aNBqH1nLSg.text: PSA: this is your Yamazaru WAKE UP CALL. I can't believe this place is rated so highly on Yelp because I left this place with buyers remorse.   The sushi tasted like iron/metallic, which said to me that it wasn't kept well and wasn't fresh. I usually gobble up all the sushi on my plate (my favorite food ever!) and this time, I found myself reluctantly eating to the point where I left almost half my meal on the table. Wish I had taken pictures to display how unpalatable the fish was.   This quality failed me so much to the point where I walked over to O-Ku to salvage my love for sushi.

b0kuUG1fQyQl4ajUYPUtFQ.text: Went here on a Saturday night and the place was packed but the host was able to grab us seats at the sushi bar. The atmosphere of the place definitely gives me NYC vibes, if you know what I mean. The place isn't huge and the place does tend to be busy (considering it's location in uptown). There is private parking. That's a huge plus for us since it's not walking distance from where we live.   We ordered the Pork Gyoza, 3 sushi rolls and a cocktail drink. The gyoza is not something to rave about. I would probably try another app the next time I go. The sushi's though...they were ah-mazing. Definitely one of the best sushi spots in CLT. Get the Yamazaru roll! The sauce with the eel is soooo divine. And I mean divine. That could've been my meal alone but I had to share... The cocktail was good too. It was sweet and I like sweet.

zXVDH6h21ZWaBbsiyg41YA.text: Living out West for 9 yes  between California and Vegas I have had some of the best sushi . I didn't think I could find great sushi in NC.  We started with  the Brussels sprouts and they were beer crispy and delicious flavor soaked in soy sauce .  All the sushi rolls we ordered in the pictures were very fresh and they had amazing flavors . The place is on the smaller side and it was packed. Fast service for how busy it was . Definitely be back !

h_4ggQN13Su0vCw1W02c8A.text: Very nice sushi bar! They have a lot of complex Maki's to choose from. Weirdly, the restaurant was full with a line outside and the sushi bar was empty. So have at it! Don't folks in Charlotte like sitting at the sushi bar? Everything was fresh and delicious. Service was fast and friendly. Park right in front in the lot. Highly recommend.

dHvMfXnZ7SZOhf9Ws_eEDA.text: Food was really good and flavorful. Intimate setting, tables are for 2 people. Bar was small. Outdoor seating is available

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried rice
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States

WMJXHigIgpPqdupIcnKYNA.text: Nigiri were on point. I always start with tamago, uni and amaebi. They were all good. The amaebi was fantastic and even came with the compulsory head, some places don't serve that. The uni was very very good too. The tamagoyaki was house made, something getting rarer with the trend of restaurants buying premade tamagoyaki. The only roll i got was the Mui Bueno, which was good. The only thing i did not like was the yakitori which lacked the usual char. I'll go back again.

9jkCaftd2vO6X-aQ4xd_5w.text: It was my first time eating at Yamazaru and we did takeout. Sushi was fantastic - I ordered the nigiri sampler combo with tuna roll and my husband ordered the salmon oyako don. The reason for the 3 stars is that the bartender who took our order tipped himself 10% while getting our order completely wrong. Instead of the salmon oyako don, we got something completely different and didn't realize until we got home. Also, I'm not sure if it's restaurant policy that a 10% tip is baked in regardless, but if you're going to require a mandatory tip even though you're not providing a service (we ordered takeout), at least get our order right.

bcXgmcuzL-oXA83ZR-dkZA.text: DELICIOUS and affordable for how good the place is. All of the sushi rolls sounded great, so it was hard to choose, but I'm sure you couldn't go wrong. We got the soft shell crab roll (can't think of the name right now) and the gladiator roll. Both tasty and filling. You could split a 3rd roll between 2 people or try and eat 2 if you're starving, but 1 with an appetizer is a great choice for a meal that won't leave you feeling stuffed to the brim. I would definitely recommend this place and go again!

2pvuM7Bud_VWi_hpq7gRjw.text: Great sushi options! I've tried many rolls. My all time favorite is the Rich and Famous.  Edamame is served steamed with salt. They have great wine and cocktail choices.

JSr84vmMfu2RAR5b1-lMTA.text: I have lately been having an obsession with all things Ahi Tuna. Yamazaru has been on my list for a while as a top sushi spot, along with their Ahi Tuna tacos and poke.  Their cocktails are delicious, and I would especially recommend the jalapeno ginger mule. They make the ginger foam in house and DARE i say it's the best ginger mule in Charlotte?! (Shh...it is!)  The restaurant is always packed because it's small and easy to get to (it's located next to Sycamore Brewing in Southend and you can access it off the Rail trail). The inside with the industrial aesthetic gives me major NYC restaurant nostalgia. I personally love perching up at the bar and watching the bartenders slinging drinks.   Favorite apps: Anything ahi tuna or the seaweed salad...SO GOOD Favorite roll: The Westwoods...easily my favorite on the menu! Favorite drink: Spicy Ginger Mule...it's not too spicy but the aftertaste heat is awesome!  I only gave it 4 out of 5 stars because of the staff. Come in knowing everyone is super friendly and the food will be awesome. However, also come in knowing your food might be delayed or there may be a credit card issue or some other communication break down. We often see our food at one bar sitting there for 5-10 minutes before someone goes and brings it to us. I love the place, but they aren't the most organized. However, it doesn't ruin the experience enough not to want to come back.  If you don't mind the delays and you enjoy awesome food and drinks...definitely check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of the best lemon drop martinis I&#39;ve ever had
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. My favorite!!! Ahi Tuna Tacos
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States

0hFC_jgw8znosJfBJK3iJg.text: Been trying to make my way over here since opening, but this place looks like it will be around for a while.  Had an early-ish dinner on a Wednesday evening and we were lucky to get a booth... by the time we finished eating, the place was packed and the bar was full.  Hosts and servers were nice enough, and there are bus-ers that walk around to make sure empty plates get whisked away to the kitchen for clean up.  Wednesday was $4 Draft Night!  So we definitely took advantage.  Ended up splitting Tuna Tacos as the appetizer and ordering a specialty roll AND a Tonkatzu Curry Rice Bowl.  Everything was delicious and... "yes" I did finish EVERYTHING.  I was super hungry and left super full.  There's a sushi bar you can sit at... and also a separate "bar" bar you can sit at as well.  Someone was eating by themselves with a laptop at the bar so it's pretty casual... I'm sure that would be frowned upon when the night progressed.  There are also outdoor tables (not too many), but a really cool spot... there was japanese TV playing on the one TV I could see from my seat.  Made for some interesting moments when I would glance up and try to figure out what was going on.

1KNoZip1OUkD_PwsHZkuCQ.text: The sushi was amazing. Best I have had in Charlotte thus far. Quaint, hip place with good service. I will come back again!

p6KJ_vPHeUaNJNEevjBfyg.text: The sushi was good but extremely expensive. The prices were comparable to New York City's best but not as good sushi. The sushi chefs were nice but the portions were small and the negiri fell apart. I won't be back.

vu6qeu71-RUGqfKPsvw2-g.text: My experience at Yamazaru was not a good one. I went on a Saturday evening so I knew it would be busy. However, given that it would be busy I would expect this business to have some order in how they maintained the crowd and patrons that were waiting to be seated. While I was seated and trying to enjoy my food the customers who were waiting were literally standing over us and yelling. When I asked our waiter if they could do something about this inconvenience, he replied no it's a small establishment and I would have to deal with it! So I could not even enjoy my meal because of the lack of order/organization they had in allowing guests who waited to be seated. It was so crowded the waiters and people delivering the food struggled to get by, this was a serious fire hazard and sanitation issue! If I were to return it would definitely be on a slower night because the sushi and food options were quite appealing. But moving forward please get a better system!

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Door

zmn4T9ka0FhvIncs8i1J5g.text: I came here for the second time to see if I could get some good uni and fatty tuna. I had a plate with maguro, toro, tobiko, masago, uni, ikura, and unagi. It was delicious. Super high quality fish, easily the best I've had in Charlotte. The wasabi also tasted more like the real deal than the paste-like horse radish based stuff you get everywhere else. I'll be coming back more often now knowing that I can take the light rail into town and walk a few minutes to get here.

fJQ78TDimINIjKlWPgk6Ig.text: Looking at the reviews, i thought this might be a good place for authentic Japanese sushi, but nope. Very Americanized. If you love rolls, they have plenty of rolls. Our server didnt have any knowledge of the fishes or its origin. Every time i'd ask she would keep having to go and ask the chefs. And every time she came back the answer was "West coast." It was funny when i asked her if the Uni was Nama Uni from Japan, she said its sea urchin. LoL  Service was ok, only ordered a couple of nigiri and waited about 20mins, and they were out of half of the exotic fishes. Overall, if you love rolls this is your place. if you're looking for authentic Japanese sushi, look elsewhere.

HGYAekk3-Aby5EiBolT3qg.text: Found myself here because the crowd of Futo Buta was out of control. After eating here I might not go back to Futo Buta. The food here is amazing!  Started with the Toro Tartare - very tasty!  The brussel sprouts are delish!  Because it was freezing out, I ordered the Tempura Udon and a salmon avocado roll. Tempura shrimp and veggies were cooked to perfection and the broth was not too salty. The menu is manageable and I cannot wait to go back and try the Tuna Bomb.

vvDT1qb_4vtgD1cGrgsbNw.text: First off, I have to say I LOVE sushi. And this place has some really fresh food, some of the freshest I've had. I always love going here to get dinner and the atmosphere is great.  Overall I have no complaints with the quality of the food, but my issue is with getting it. Sushi normally takes a fair bit of time to come to the table and I get that, but they take FOREVER here. I could be waiting upwards of 45 minutes to an hour before getting food. There's also the fact that if you order over the phone, they'll put you on hold for 30 minutes with the restaurant ambiance of people eating and the bartenders making drinks in the background. It takes less than a minute to write down a call-in order, even if you're busy.   I had to hang up because my phone died while I was on hold...with a restaurant...on a day in the middle of a work week. Come on...that shouldn't happen... Worth noting too that it's happened more than once, it seems they put callers on a low-priority list when it comes to ordering food. I'm okay with waiting a few minutes or so but after spending enough time for me to actually have my cell phone die on me while holding is absurd. That definitely turns me off from wanting to call after a long day at work to get some great food. Kind of a shame, really.  Foods good though, if you have 2-3 hours to spare for dinner. I recommend the sushi rolls for everyone who loves Japanese cuisine, and the Kiss of Fire is phenomenal. Don't hesitate to try everything, all of their menu items are freaking delicious.

qa2kqAN3M-UZLGDUYLmowA.text: Picky about sashimi/sushi? Why yes, I am (very)...This place is in one word, "yum". Enough said.

BX-3ImOII20L6ku0RlIxwQ.text: Stranded in Charlotte tonight so  Yelped for a sushi place. Yamazaru is awesome with wonderful food, service and drinks! Great price too for the high quality of food !  We had dynamite roll it was delicious! Highly recommend!

7DzlpCLr6nmpDdVgkm2lLw.text: Good sushi. Fresh and decent portions. Sampled the Toro, Hamachi, Amaebi, and the Angry Spider. I would definitely come back without hesitation. Busy Friday night and food came super fast.

7aUC4q9ohhS7YSg-kb8ilA.text: Down to the important details  Food - had the Miso Ramen and it was amazing   Service - super quick and very friendly  Overall great new place, can't wait to go again and try the sushi. The beer selection was great and at a very reasonable price point.  Ps.  If you like spice ask for the chili powder (tasty)

8s0Q45owYTAdJ0auweWD8g.text: Great price, best sushi in Charlotte and the people, awesome. I guarantee it, if you don't like it I will eat your sushi, not a problem.

NcY9jJbH9YrxadFT6BpMUg.text: This place is amazing! I ordered the Tonkotsu ramen and Yamazaru roll for take out. Everything was packed very nice and the food was amazing. Customer service was great as well. I cant wait to come back and try other menu items!

geIioJkXr3jqbLRJYzWGBQ.text: Excellent all around experience- drinks atmosphere most especially the food! We had the Yamazaru, West Woods and Gladiator rolls. All were excellent quality and prepared in timely fashion for a Friday night. Ginger salad dressing was delicious but was served with only lettuce. Their warm saki was delightful and seemed to be bottomless- lol! Great location and ample parking. Super attentive staff and loved the urban steel decor/ atmosphere. Prices were very reasonable for quality and location- def will return!

2ad_HsDhuoZO-gvLGxmMTQ.text: It's like If Rusans had a a hotter sister. That's Yamazaru in my personal opinion. Haha

xov_5GsPfMM9EJP-lwCgDA.text: We went for dinner, we sat outside, the food was ok, I've had better sushi before but it was ok, for the sushi I'll be back, unfortunately the service was not that good.. took them long time to get our food and didn't was friendly at all.. I guess it was busy and it really depends on your waitress but we'll try again.

iXrHQ6vlxyaNghmLykpNIA.text: Seems over rated. Waited 5 minutes at the front door before being greeted. We flagged down a busser to ask to be put on the waiting list. Not a hospitable bunch at all. They were out of some menu items and the beer I ordered. The food was good but not great. Knife work on sushi was mediocre and rolls were not rolled right. We will continue our search for our favorite sushi spot.

KQh1SWlIkCg8VmldrDYiVw.text: I give this 5 stars because the atmosphere was fun and lively and the food was very good for the price. The onigiri appetizers were like $2-3 and they were a decent size and tasted great. I also got uni nigiri which pretty good quality and a yummy yamazaru roll. They had a nice selection of food and drinks to pick from.

whJMzKXaddYWHgNnYRKu-Q.text: This is my new favorite sushi spot. Great location in the Southend. The sushi was sooooo good. Very meaty! The service was absolutely amazing. I loved the atmosphere. It was a fun spot for girls night. I will definitely be back!

e7KU7EnWTrXL6gy5dtOiQg.text: Aaron dom ate here and loooooooved it. Sushi? Amazing! Chicken teriyaki? Phenomenal! Sake was delish. He doesn't even like Japanese cuisine but he loved this place. Love love love

2BNoz8YuqpbiaLx_IvDBoQ.text: What a treat!  From the Steamed Buns to the Rich & Famous roll.   Super atmosphere and great vibe.  Must have sushi.

TymL09xzaLyVrasRpT1M6w.text: I moved here from Los Angeles so I like to think I am quite spoiled when it comes to good sushi. Have been pretty disappointed with majority of the sushi here in Charlotte until I tried this spot out. Absolutely delicious. I would still go to the place if it was in LA and that's saying something. They have great thick cuts of fresh fish and it is at a completely reasonable price. $5 hand rolls this tasty? Yeah, I'm in. Definitely quite busy always as it's only open for dinner but definitely worth your money.

HzMsyy9YDkK6FBlfe0nNqw.text: Amazing !!!!!! The fish was super fresh their wine selection in really great and the service is friendly and caring. One Little girl was acting up and one of the waiters gave her mom a chi-chew candy to make her happy super nicely (making sure to ask the mom before letting the girl see it , in case she wasn't allowed to have it .

4H4R0HDuGGXG4WdK0lDq_g.text: Don't know why this place misses the lists of good sushi in Charlotte! Sushi with flavor and an ample amount of fish for a good price! No more sad tuna rolls jammed with cucumber.

0ZUgux2Btlare9FE3KS6Ug.text: At first, I was overwhelmed by the amount of options on their menu. It took me forever to decide which two rolls I'd get, but boy was it delicious. We sat at the sushi bar, which is one of my favorite spots so I can see competed rolls before it heads to someone's table. We asked a couple times what they were, and made mental notes to order it next time!!   Both my rolls and my boyfriends 2 rolls we agreed may have been our favorite rolls EVER!!! And the girls next to us ordered about 10 things and kept saying wow, that's so good to everything.  I'm already dreaming of my next visit!!

ryMWzV_ViEg193vInGisUA.text: This place is a step up from Ru San.. and I know they're sisters.. customer service was soo bad at ru San that I haven't been back since.   Yama is the total opposite. Great customer service. Nice ambiance. But like Ru San. It's hard to hold a convo since the place is small and it can get loud in there..   I ordered 2 types of sushi which I like a lot.. However, I also order the Yaki Soba. Which I didn't like it at all. I didn't say anything because it's no point.   I enjoyed my cold sake and finish my night with a full satisfied belly

awi2Qizyb_UOJdDmgN5KqQ.text: I'm sad to write this but...this place has been progressively getting worse since it opened. The food has become pretty mediocre, the service is so disorganized, the waiters seem to be at the same time lazy and frazzled and its an overall pretty poor experience.   Last night was the last time I will go there:  First, our sushi never arrived. I assumed he hadn't put it on the ticket and we were pretty full after our meal anyway but then I realized that it was delivered to the wrong table and since we weren't checked on the entire meal we weren't able to say that it was missing until we saw it on our bill.   Second, I burned my tongue on Udon that had an over-steamed-microwaved taste. I later started to feel nauseous after a piece of tempura broccoli didn't taste right. When I bit into it it was brown and squishy, totally off. The tempura was so greasy that I ended up getting sick (a few times) when we got home.   Third and most importantly, our bill was $20.57 I tipped to make it $25. I got an email the following morning from my bank saying that a transaction from Yamazaru Sushi & Sake Charlotte for $344.00 had processed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I called my bank and was able to dispute it to be returned within a few days which is fine for me. What makes me mad is that, for some, that error could leave them with $0 in their bank account! That is not a small mistake.   Yamazaru needs to work on their food quality, having a dedicated server to each table who actually introduces themselves and checks on you throughout your meal, food runners who know the table numbers, and most importantly to make sure they run your card for the right table.

AZqS2RE0t-hxSAyUr-fo1w.text: The atmosphere is fine... nothing spectacular. Just a standard, modern eatery. Not bad, just nothing fun or fancy like other sushi places in Charlotte. Pretty basic.  Based on the two times I've visited, the service is adequate. The first time was an older guy who clearly had too many tables. We had to constantly get his attention for service. I don't feel this was his fault; they seemed really short staffed for a busy Thursday night. The second time was a very young server that was nice, just clearly very new and inexperienced. No major issues; just minor things like knocking my sake cup over putting dishes down on the table, transactional service, etc. We all have to start somewhere so I'm not holding this against them.  My main issue was the food. I have been to no less than 50 sushi restaurants in my lifetime so far and we felt the quality was subpar. Agedashi tofu should be firm and hold together while eating. Theirs is swimming in sauce so long the coating is puffy and soggy, falling apart as you're eating it. The sushi would be better if they took the time to prepare it correctly. Spicy tuna should be diced, not a mush.  I may be wrong in this particular case, but it's generally been my experience that the meat's quality is not good so it gets pulverized, mixed with flavoring to make it edible, and presented as "spicy tuna". Another red flag was the really long strings of sinew in the mush. Spicy tuna does not normally have that..  Tonight, we both felt unwell after about an hour. Not straight up food poisoning, just icky. The only thing we both ate was the two sushi rolls, so I'm pretty sure there may have been a minor issue with the quality. Overall, not the worst place I've been but I've given it two attempts and we won't be back.

u_Er0MaS9195z2yPxp4EtQ.text: Came here for dinner. Yamazaru definitely caters to a more Western palate as majority of the offerings are of the fusion variety.  There was one roll which I believe was called Krystal Rainbow. Inside the roll was a weird combo of imitation crab and lettuce. It wrapped in rice paper that you'd typically use for spring rolls. That was a real head scratcher for us. Would not order that again.  We ordered a bunch of other rolls as well but none were memorable. On a positive note, we did not get food poisoning despite the blazing heat outside. Also, service was friendly and prices are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States

0lUROzSAs3lVErVoQxIBJQ.text: After reading all the raving reviews, I expected a super-nice dining experience here. Sadly, I wasn't too impressed.  The restaurant itself is very small...very narrow layout at that. Just basic wooden decor...nothing fancy or unusual. That itself is no big deal.   Guess the bad impression started and ended with the service...or the lack thereof? First of all, I met up with a fairly big group of girls for an early dinner (reservations made in advance). The long table was ready for us, and the bus boy was there to fill the water (which was lukewarm, not even cold!) and fix the rocky table...but there was no waiter. ??? After at least 15 minutes, we actually had to ask for one. After taking our order, the waiter did not come by even once - at least to my side of the table - to ask if we needed anything. Usually when you dine with a group larger than 6 peeps, the service isn't the greatest. Still, this stood out as being one of the worst group dining service...in that there really wasn't one lol. Of course, they tipped themself 20% since it was a big group. SO undeserved in this case!  As for the food, I ordered one of their Sushi/Maki Rolls, "West End Roll", along with a Tonkatsu Ramen. A-Plus for this Maki Roll (Maybe A-Minus, given not super-cool or creative in presentation), but the Ramen was so Blah, I'd give it a D! The Ramen was super-bland, even tasted as if it had been watered down. I didn't even bother drinking much of the broth since it was nearly tasteless. Most Tonkatsu Ramens I've had around town have been delicious (and much spicier), so this was a huge disappointment.  Maybe this was an off night, but it just wasn't that great...any of it. I may go back one day to try another Maki Roll or two, but NEVER their Ramen again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkatsu Ramen

nz7YLouYD5qH3huhYFJHRA.text: One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in Charlotte! The location and prices are great. I don't think I can find another Chirashi bowl for the price they offer and as fresh. They do get pretty busy at night so expect a wait. Some of my favorites is the agedashi tofu, salmon jaw, salmon tacos, tonkotsu ramen, Chirashi rice bowl, Salmon rice bowl, and takoyaki. Highly recommended. If the parking lot is full, you can always park on the street.

gTdk6yw6YgCHbxoKglVMEA.text: I showed up at Yamazaru with high hopes, but honestly this was probably one of the most disappointing Japanese meals I've had in a long, long time.  I don't really like giving 1 or 2 stars, but this was just plain bad food for those who are Japanese food snobs like me who live in NYC with access to excellent Japanese food and having just came back from Japan this past holiday.  Service - lots of people standing around and I had to wave people down multiple times to come back and take our order or to get utensils.  They have a lot of people working here and honestly not that many tables to serve.  They were nice, though.  The prices were very reasonable, I'll give them that ($10 a roll, $10 for a bowl of udon) which should have been one of red flags for this place.  For appetizers we had the shishito peppers which came on a skewer for some reason and were more soggy in the sauce than anything.  The takoyaki was a strange texture - almost bready, which isn't supposed to be the case.  The tuna tartare was basically inedible - I took one bite and basically put the rest back.  It was goopy and you could hardly even separate it as it was one giant goop of slimy tuna - absolutely disgusting!  Our entire table barely touched it.  The saving grace was the hamachi which had great flavor and good kick with the thin slice of jalapeno and the ponzu.  For my roll, I ordered the Angry Spider which came luke warm and was hardly bite sized.  The rice texture was awful and the entire roll just didn't really have much flavor that I'm used to in spider rolls.  I ate once piece and that's pretty much it.  For the tempura udon, it came in a shiitake-tasting broth and random vegetables in it.  Udon texture was fine, but the whole thing tasted like instant udon you can buy at the supermarket.  The tempura itself was ok.... the batter itself was mediocre - nothing like you'd get at a legit Japanese place.  The prices reflect quality here.  You can find way better stuff at Baku in Southpark or even O-ku right down the street.

A-B0lU1oKGSXJ2_Si_gcWA.text: This place is a sushi gem in south end!!! They have such an awesome menu that anyone who likes sushi will have a tough time picking just one roll.   The sushi chefs are all super friendly and knowledgeable, if you're lucky enough to get a seat at the sushi bar. They'll answer questions for you about the different ingredients they use and what goes well with what.   I'm not a fan of rolls that have cream chese or any type of mayonnaise in them so I typically aim for the simpler rolls. But here there are about a half a dozen specialty rolls that meet my "requirements" lol. The most recent roll ive enjoyed is their Salmon Madness.  I also typically end up with 2-3 pieces of nigiri The Mrs.  really likes their Mooshoguru (spelling) roll,  but has a tough time finishing it by herself.   Their shoshito peppers are a hit as well.   All of their fish seems to be really well stored and good quality, which makes such a big difference. If you've ever been to a sushi buffet you'll know what I mean.   I just wish they had a bigger space, it not uncommon to get bumped by people making their way through the walkways.   All in all, I love this place and just writing this review makes me want a Salmon Madness Roll! (YUM)

Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. A few pieces of Nigiri (Himachi,  Madai, and Toro)
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi side of the menu

F1hOsefEkTAp2VLJMf2IAg.text: Yamazaru has some of the best sushi in Charlotte and it shows with the constant wait times. This place is very cozy and intimate with parking spots in the front which is a relief if you know anything about parking in South End.   We got the lettuce wraps and crab wanton for appetizers. The lettuce wraps were good but somewhat salty. I don't really like PF Chang's like that but they still to me have the best lettuce wraps.   The sushi is definitely the highlight at this restaurant! Yamazaru has some creative names for their sushi's and equally good tasting. I got the angry spider sushi roll with a variety of crab avocado, peppers and green leaf topped with spicy crab  and eel sauce.   In addition, the Philly roll and avocado roll which were equally satisfying. I would come here for the sushi and you won't be disappointed. The wait is a little long to get in and your food as well. Nevertheless, everyone tries to be attentive to your needs.

me90E63wgtR0LEu5nZy9aA.text: I'm a big fan of Yamazaru.   I've been here probablyyyy 4 or 5 times since living in Charlotte for about a year and a half. So a pretty good clip. I'm new into the sushi game and Yamazaru is definitely one of the better places I've had in Charlotte!  They have a gigantic regular menu selection and I've never been displeased with any of my orders. They've also always got a bunch of special rolls to choose from which I am a big fan of.  The best thing about Yamazaru in my opinion, is the fact that they let us do sake bombs. That was one of our favorite group drinking activities in DC and it's nice to have a place that will allow us to drink a little bit down here too.   Definitely a good Friday night Sake bomb or a date spot! There's usually a wait but they'll take your name down and allow you to roam around for a drink beforehand.  Highly recommended!

36ijPRljcTQMxSu5HCl7fA.text: Heard good things about this place and the first time we attempted to go here it was a 40 min wait. So we assumed it was because it must be really good. After actually dining here we realized that it may have been because the service is a little on the slow side. That is enough to make me hesitant to come here again. However, they do make up for it with some pretty good sushi. I ordered the tempura philly roll and my boyfriend ordered the spider roll. Both were unique and delicious! They also had more standard rolls for people who are not as adventurous with their sushi.  Overall, the food itself I say is great and reasonably priced. I just wish the service was a little more prompt. But I would be willing to give it a second chancez

-oxcH0ekk1BpxnrT_hzeIg.text: I've been to Yamazaru several times.  Restaurant is on the smaller side, with a very warm and inviting atmosphere. Service is almost always friendly and attentive. The menu is...extensive: offering Americanized sushi rolls, yakitori, udon, etc.    For my last visit, I ordered the chirashi along with several nigiri. Chirashi was stuffed with a wide variety of sushi. I was pleasantly surprised to find chutoro, saba, and surf clam in my bowl. Their chirashi, at least that night, was incredible value!  They were out of one of the items I wanted and they actually gave me an extra piece of saba!  The nigiri I ordered were also very generous portions. Overall I've had great experiences with Yamazaru and would definitely recommend this place!

dlHvAjPSrw3anJcsZBjfcQ.text: Holy wow! This place is amazing! I have been searching for a good sushi place since I moved to Charlotte. Haven't had much luck until last night. This restaurant is adorable first off, and the atmosphere is perfect. Great for a date night or casual outing with friends!   The restaurant itself is super small, can fit probably under 100 people. However they do try to move quickly enough to keep the flow moving. In the warmer days there is outdoor seating which helps! They open at 5pm everyday and if you get there earlier vs later there isn't a wait.   The food is amazing! We don't prefer the "real sushi" we are more of a cooked roll people. So their selection with that was good! Everything I normally do enjoy. The rice bowls were also what we had! The rice is so fresh and so tasty. The flavors in the bowls were so good. I didn't see a bad thing brought out of their kitchen. Great bar menu too!   I truly need to add the service, that's a huge factor. The waiters are SO friendly!! That makes a huge difference too. Everyone that worked there go out of their way. Highly recommend this pl

H9VCp-zbceRW_I96oDRe9g.text: 4.5 stars. It's a good, cheap, and fun spot. The price per nigiri sushi is unbeatable considering they offer such a wide selection. This is a very popular dinner spot. I barely snagged a spot at the bar around 9:30PM.  Nigiri ranged from $1.50 to $3.50 a piece which is absolutely amazing. I started with the takoyaki which was perfectly crispy outside and creamy inside. I got tako, squid, toro, hamachi, salmon, scallop, mackerel, eel, shrimp, uni, tuna. I also had a nice glass of sake recommended by the bartender. The fish isn't the freshest but considering the prices, it was pretty good.  I wish I had more time to try more of the menu! Service was good. Parking available. Charlotte's food scene, in what is diverse, does very well in each category.

y8hgzV9ED2ZttNzAVQdeAg.text: Wow! What a treat. We got in around 7:20pm and there was an hour long wait. So we decided to sit outside despite of the hat suggesting it's hot. We don't mind the sun. Pretty quickly the sun set around after 8 and it was nice and cool. We ordered the cucumber basil martini style and my eyes were wide with happiness. We ordered a bunch of sushi, sashimi and some kitchen appetizers. We were given a complimentary spicy mule drink and that made my boyfriends day. We enjoyed it a lot. Would defiantly recommend it and if you sit outside it's lovely. Casual attire is good. Plan to stay a while and eat some good sushi. It's worth the wait. The owners are super nice. We will definitely be going back very very soon.

WRHd4GP0PaMbFxXJQLbKzg.text: Yamazura offers exceptional service and excellent, fresh sushi. Their location makes an easy walk from anywhere in South End. From their first week to this week I am consistently pleased with both their service and great food. A must try in the South End Area!

0a_1XBpSoWKXmVJhy2JIYQ.text: Everything was very fresh and extremely tasty. Wife said it was the best miso soup she's ever had. I especially enjoyed the Gladiator roll. Friendly and attentive staff - Recommend !

ntymYXQeb1NF6T-OqOj99Q.text: Finally found a reasonably priced sushi spot with great food. I have found that Charlotte either has high priced/high quality sushi or average priced/low quality sushi.   Yamazaru has average pricing for a small sit down sushi restaurants to but the quality is comparable to their restaurants where you pay two to three times as much.   The staff is friendly and checks on you often to ensure you have everything you need, refilling your waters everytime they visit.   The sushi is very fresh and well crafted. They have tons of options to choose from and some of the rolls are very unique. The takeout is easy and quick without sacrificing quality or service.   The restaurant itself is visually appealing and clean. They have a large, fully stocked bar to eat/drink at in addition to the actual sushi bar.   Located right in the heart of South End, it is a great addition to the area.

xv29dGbrj7TGasuWlFkYJw.text: Pleasantly delighted! Positive experience overall. Although I went when there was a low tide, so service was pretty good. I ordered Three Kingdoms and Zootopia upon the waiter's suggestion. I loved Zootopia, mainly, because I love tempura sushi. All of the ingredients were fresh and well combined. The water tasted a little strange though. Overall, I'd definitely come back.

I've only been here once as of this writing and I was in the mood for a bowl of ramen. It was simple and solid. For ramen, I personally prefer the higher quality selections at Futo Buta for about the same price. I believe sushi is Yamazaru's specialty so next time I'll order that instead.

3GRcIFrkl_2-_L9_9gZcvw.text: Limited seating space, reservations not available, figure a wait around busy dinner time. Sushi is good, especially the Gladiator roll (my favorite). ve315CzevrTmJIdQHUSqQQ.text: Okish !! Not great.. too much sesame in everything. Ambience and music is good. Service is quick. Appetizers are good.. but main course is bland. Fried rice and fried noodles are not fried kind of sticky and wet!

1qgbpgxwxJJih64MaDOfHg.text: I love Rusans. So this is the tapa version of Rusans. Smaller portions, smaller sushi menu, but FULL bar. It's not as loud and overly crowded compared to Rusans. Rusans is great for a huge group. yamazaru is great for small dinner dates/get-togethers. Definitely a must try! I'm not a pork belly fan but their pork belly in their steam bun appetizer and in the ramen is good!! GOOD! Not too thick or thin cut, not too salty, and flavoring is great!   Green curry mussels appetizer is great. Light and refreshing. Curry is NOT thick. And awesome flavoring.   Drinks are great. My favorite is the cucumber basil! So freaking refreshing especially since summer is coming around.   I'm not a ramen expert. BUT...I would say try the Tonkotsu ramen. Only thing I would add is extra spice but that's because I like spicy! Otherwise, it was good. The boiled egg wasn't over cooked. It was medium. That's how I like it! Yum.  I also like their brussel sprouts! I think it's chargrilled? I would ask for it to be crispier but that's how I  would prefer it!   They still have the hamachi kama, the infamous seafood fried rice, and some other Rusans favorites on the menu.   I always feel so welcome and at home. Lots of love to Hata and Eric! They ALWAYS take great care of me and whoever I am bring with rather it's here or Rusans.

The place was ridiculously packed and we were quoted for an hour wait but it honestly didn't take that long so don't be discouraged when they quote you a long wait time. We ordered a few appetizers. 238pvabBsPYG7ehJpIC3KQ.text: I wanted to try this place last week but finding a place 2 Park was frustrating-~ so I arrived 15mins b4 they opened & I was able to find a parking spot right in front of the door. I wasn't the only person to arrive 15 mins early ~ 5 other parties were waiting as well.  The sushi is average ~ i gave it 5 stars because they have outside seating & the waiter was attentive, knowledgeable & hilarious!!!!!   I started with lemon water (because the water container was cute \o/) I opted to try the "Up the Pagoda" which is 3 "shots" of 3 different types of Sake ~ they were good.   I then tried the Jawbreaker (which I thought would've been spicy) NOPE! The sweet crunchiness of the roll stole my heart. I also had the Scorpion roll ~ a basic American roll. The shrimp fried rice was good ~ definitely a serving for 2 people to share.   They had 1 item on the menu that I'm dying to try ~ Octopus ~ but I'll wait until my homegirl gets here so I can have her cheerlead me on. Lol.

UBf5ZTAgeIhUvjtl7IeMHQ.text: Terrible customer service. Tried to call multiple times for a take out order and was hung up on each time. The final time I called and tried to explain that I had been hung up on each time prior, the hostess cut me off and asked what I wanted to order. She never asked my name, number, or credit card information for the order and hung up again before I had a chance to question her. I called back for a 6th time to ask about my order and was put on hold and hung up on yet again. Will not be ordering or going to this establishment again. Get it together.

Sitting at the sushi bar was a great idea!  Excited to live just a few blocks down and have a new regular sushi spot!

f_Sx4zPE7L5-8EOSIBquBw.text: This was our first experience at Yamazaru.  In a concise summation: Reasonably priced and delicious.    Let me just start by saying that I am obsessed with Ru Sans (kind of in an embarrassing way). We sat down and looked at the sushi selection.. a lot of the rolls shared the same names as ones at Ru Sans.. My boyfriend did some good ol' google research and sure enough, the owner is the same.  Anyhow, we tried two rolls that I hadn't seen on Ru San's menu - the South End roll and the Tarzan - both were delicious!  The South End has thin slices of lemon on top (including the rind), which was wasn't sure about at first but it was AMAZING.  I will definitely order this one again.  Tarzan has avocado on top and cream cheese inside so if you're a fatty like me and you love both of those things, this one is a good pick too.  I will definitely be going back!

nTCUCnwgIMW_FhdKcxSPXQ.text: I've been here twice with friends. Once on a week day, it was pretty empty and we had a quick service. The other time was a Saturday night, we had to wait an hour + just to get seated. It was crowded but the servers still did their best. They have great food and prices and portions l! Will deff make another visit!!

E7e36da9YWpH9Co6iOW_Rg.text: Great atmosphere and great sushi! Conveniently located near ol' Sycamore Brewery and the New Bern lightrail station.

MAL7xkAga1jj-6E9mKdrmA.text: I've been here several times and this is definitely one of the better sushi/Japanese places in Charlotte. Their sashimi is always top-notch, if not a bit pricey. Straying away from sushi and sashimi, some of the other dishes don't quite hit the mark though. I've been pretty happy with the gyoza and the tonkatsu, although the tonkatsu is usually a bit tougher than I'd prefer. The yakisoba and the karaage were both big misses for me, and were bland. The karaage wasn't breaded enough, either, and was oily.   Putting my misgivings about some of the dishes aside, just on the merit of their sushi/sashimi offerings I'm giving them 4 stars. I'm not sure if they've updated their menus, but previously they stated they had both Kanpachi and Madai, but neither are stocked anymore, I believe due to a lack of demand.

ppVNxB-kwBYJ630w40oEpQ.text: Very friendly and fast service  Very alive and hopping atomsphere  Tonkitsu Ramen was yummy and the pork belly was succulent.   Agedashi Tofu was solid, the sauce a good  flavor, the tofo was a bit firm and bland. Tha accompanying shishito pepper were bland.   The cucumber salad was very thinly sliced pieces including seeds soaked mainly soy sauce only. I did finish.   The tako yaki, fried octopus balls were pretty tasty and were chewy.   Kalbi was tough and very chewy,  dry and an had an off taste... i had to send this dish back since i did not want to eat it not take it home. They kindly this is dish off the check  Again overall, a good average to slighly above Japanese with really good prices.   I will get sushi next time...

qt4tkVAefitY0vzrdhvyrA.text: This place is going to kill it. We arrived on a Wednesday about 6:30 and the tables were full. We gladly pulled up to the bar. The bartenders were amazing! Brian and Mike took great care of us. Brian was super friendly. Introduced himself and shook our hands.   The spicy mule is their signature cocktail and my new favorite drink. They make homemade ginger beer so its not overly sweet. The ginger comes out strong as does the spiciness.   I didn't think the sushi was super memorable, but the pricing is great compared to other places in the area. I did really like the mango tango. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango tango, UFO, zoothopia

NN9XxDsxhDEP-QvKGctB_Q.text: Between 2.5 to 3 stars.  Service is spotty.  Need to ask multiple times for things we need, especially they weren't busy at all at 6pm.  Is it fast casual?   Not really, but they left a bottle of water which I don't mind.  Is it full service?  Yes, expecting 20% service fees with the excellent service correspondence to it; but no, it didn't deliver.  Sushi is avg at best.  No wasabi between the rice and fish.  Rice is not vinegarette.  Rice is also mushy.  Price is avg, it seems like you get what you paid for.  Definitely better quality than their sister restaurant  @ru san's,  but still a tad off from being solid 3 or 4 stars.  Will give it one more shot.

mDWF6YmClvkh6oMT680ORw.text: I adore this place - great atmosphere and green tea to start you out. Excellent service with very friendly staff and flawless sushi. I tried the Salmon Crudo summer special instead of the ceviche because it had salmon (my favorite fish) and I was not disappointed. Bright and beautiful flavors, pretty to look at and easy to eat! Went with my favorite nigiri to finish things off - my traditional test of a sushi restaurant - and again everything was perfect and delicious. Surprise hit of the night was the spicy scallop nigiri !

Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy scallop nigiri is as awesome as it looks.
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Crudo!! It&#39;s a summer special so get it before they stop serving :)

BoO6sNGbF2mruZ6wSM3vgw.text: We heard about this new place from our Japanese friends so we decided to give it a try. If you don't want to wait, you need to come before 7 or make reservation ahead of time. There are plenty of parking spaces next to the restaurant and on the street. They have a good selection of Izakaya dish (small tapas style).  Some of the highlights: Tako yaki has a good portion of octopus inside it. The Gindara miso is tasty and the Hamachi Kama is huge and meaty. We finished the night with Tonkatsu ramen. The ramen has a good texture and the broth is wonderful. It would have been better if I can add several slices of pork and bean sprouts. I would have given them a five stars if the acoustic of the restaurant is better. It was hard to converse with the person across the table.

kqllrEd4uIxjzSDFg6ZYLg.text: I'm honestly not complaining, but... how is this place not destroying the Charlotte sushi market? Even with places like O-Ku, Ru Sans, Nikko, and the fabled Helles and Dunkel sushi (oh yea, that's real), I still see so much potential for Yamazaru to lead the pack here.  Saturday evening, about 7:30pm, The Lady and I walked into Yamazaru for our first time, and to our surprise, there were still several tables open and available. The very first thing we noticed, however, is how the two-tops on the patio were filled with people and their dogs. Super good to know. Anyways, we were seated and our server, Phat, came up and greeted us immediately. We ordered a plate of their tiger shrimp appetizer which featured delicious shrimp in a chili sauce, and little rice bowls that you could use to make mini tacos. I'm lucky I even was able to snap a photo before The Lady destroyed them. Together, we ordered 3 sushi rolls, the Angry Spider, a specialty called the Jawbreaker, and the West Woods. Phat told us that the restaurant was unfortunately out of snow crab, the main meat in Jawbreaker, and they were using imitation crab and the price was reduced $3 because of this. The Lady and I agreed that wasn't the best option and ended up choosing New Moon instead, but major props to Phat for even telling us this.  Our wait was long. Probably too long for me to be giving 5 stars, considering the table behind us ordered several things that came out almost immediately, while our 3 rolls took about 45 minutes. But you know why I'm not docking? Because Phat came and checked on us, assured that he was pushing the kitchen, and apologized so many times and said that he would be worried if he were in our positions. I don't know why it took so long, nor do I really care so much. An attentive waiter can make time pass a lot faster.   We see one sushi roll go to the table behind us, and both The Lady and I eye it. Ours should be coming out first. Turns out, the table behind didn't order it, and Phat, as a courtesy, gave that whole roll to us on the house. I don't remember what it was, but it was topped with Tuna and Avacado and the fish was extremely fresh and flavorful. Our three rolls come out, gorgeous presentation. All of the tempura pieces were light and crispy, and not the least bit greasy. We were uber impressed with the price point that came along with it too! 3 rolls + appetizer came out about $42, a fantastic price for sushi for two!  At the end of the night, we knew we'll have to come back. The menu is extensive, but luckily there will always be a table so we can try it all :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our beautiful rolls! New Moon, Angry Spider, and West Woods.
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiger shrimp appetizer with shrimp&#39;s worst nightmare in the back.

9C_mRBeValANWDEEIzcUxA.text: Value wise this is perhaps the best restaurant in all of Charlotte -- the food quality is incredible and if you're looking for good sushi, superb is an understatement. They don't have a huge variety of fish however their selection good and very high quality.   I'd say this is within the top 5 Japanese restaurants in Charlotte overall and in terms of sushi alone it's top 3. This is my go-to place anytime I want great sushi and amazing service.

4WuUhH61b1kdp1d4hF44gQ.text: Hands down best sushi in the city. Always fresh, flavorful and well presented. Go early as parking fills up fast and the wait times can be lengthy!

kjc3Mgsx16VTDR3JXbPbhA.text: Great food and great service in a nice atmosphere! Full bar and sake menu. We had the Ichiban roll, chicken fried rice, and bacon & scallops. Can't wait to come back!

YEiYqu1-QN6bFyzk_Ntu3g.text: Yamazaru is a legit sushi-ya and Izakaya. The menu is huge with plenty of options for everyone. Prices are very wallet friendly too, especially on the nigiri and traditional rolls like negitoro. I was super happy to find natto maki (fermented soy bean sushi roll), which is hard to come by in the US since it's usually only Japanese people who like it because of the smell. They also have onigiri which is a Japanese comfort food (basically a triangle of rice with a filling and wrapped in seaweed). In addition I tried the black cod which was very good and a fancy cucumber wrapped roll which was fresh and tasty. Service was efficient and the drinks looked good too (large selection of sake and $8 for cocktails). I would definitely come back when in Charlotte again. I liked this place much better than Futobuta and O-ku sushi, which I also tried in the same week.

photos.caption: Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miso black cod - very good
Photo of Yamazaru - Charlotte, NC, United States. Natto maki, negitoro maki, and cucumber wrapped roll (no rice) - all great, especially the natto :)

rY6E_koWGOOm3JXHHBMn2A.text: Easily one of my favorite spots in Charlotte for sushi!  Love sitting at the sushi bar and watching them create such beautiful food, and looking at all the varieties of fish.  They offer a great selection of specialty and traditional sushi rolls, and a wide variety of sashimi!  All are incredibly delish.  Cocktails are great and they have a good selection of local drafts.  For sushi, it isn't a bad price either!

OKz1CVqm2Pqk1bBwUIFKVw.text: This is our new sushi hangout. Fresh sushi, friendly service, a dedicated parking lot and little or no wait time. Can't beat that! We love the Hamachi Habanero dish...I can eat 3 orders all by myself.  The tuna taco is also a must.  Tip: Stick with the sushi; skip the ramen...go to Futo Buta for that.

wuPfQuFP2xtgIgV_Xeq3HA.text: Great spot in Charlotte. Great service and amazing food. The sushi rolls. The appetizers. The sake. All... Yes. Yes. Yes. I will hands down, say that this place has my favorite appetizer in the QC now (fujimori). We had the tuna toro tartar...yes.  The fujimori was obviously amazing since it's now my favorite app in this whole city. Hold on, let me pause, because we started w/ miso soup, & this often gets underwhelmingly noticed; we are very cold natured folks and typically start out every meal with soup, so we comment on every. single. soup.  So, our comment on this miso was....drumroll...fabulous! Enough seaweed and tofu to make one very happy. After the soup, we were still cold, & our wonderful sever (Phat) turned the air up for us. Love! So, back to the food- after the soup, we indulged in the toro, the fujimori, and then the rolls. The Westwood and the Jawbreaker. Both must-haves. The Westwood was awesome...an easy "yes".  The Jawbreaker, though. I get it. You break your jaw from it dropping through the floor after tasting the amazing delicacy of this roll. Yummmm.  My fiance doesn't care too much for seared salmon, but this slightly seared scrumptiousness had even him salivating. We sipped on the one hot sake offered on the menu during the whole meal and it was a perfect accompaniment. So, formal review: Service, A+; Food taste/quality/showmanship/etc, A+++;  Atmosphere, A, casual but trendy and slightly loud space (could use some carpet to absorb noise).  Basically, we were already planning what we would order next by the time our bill came & while we were unbuttoning the top button of our pants to finish that meal. Yeah, we'll be back....for the ramen, the Japanese curry, the many other apps we didn't get to, the many other sushi rolls we didn't try, and of course, the sake and the wonderful service.

I1fzomyrHETUfdfbaUeQFA.text: This sushi is one of the best, if not the best in town. I have had it take-out and eatten there. It's always packed but they are realistic about wait times. I can't even describe what makes it better - it might be the rice. I feel like they are snobs at O-Ku and Yamazaru is a normal spot that is just crushin' it. Perfect for a date, double date, post-Sycamore dinner, or take-out after a long day.

h7VrY34eKhMIzlxbBgyygw.text: Get there early! (It's small so there isn't much seating)  Get the calamari appetizer!   Great sushi, great service, cozy environment. Perfect for date night. An easy walk to Sycamore Brewery for pre or post dinner drinks.

IWBtU6xNcOpofkR2RK96EQ.text: $10 for a cocktail is criminal but the food is amazing and the service was super nice. Everyone was helpful and considering how busy it was my table of 4 got seated, waited, and fed really fast.

-Nvu8DM2hWBJlHLgFSw9WQ.text: Like some other reviewers I also agree that they have very affordable prices, but you get what you paid for. They have a very extensive menu varying from sushi, ramen, udon, and rice bowls. You can find something for everybody on the menu! They atmosphere has a nice gals night/date night feel. We ordered the salmon rice ball, tako yaki, seafood udon & green mango roll! The salmon rice ball has literally less than a teaspoon of salmon and just consisted of rice. I also didn't enjoy the tako yaki, it was too mushy and doughy inside, I've had better. The seafood udon was good, and so was the green mango roll! Our service was also good, our food came out fast and our server was nice(: Overall I feel like the price reflects the quantity of the food, but I don't think I would find myself necessarily craving anything!

tJi2gHTWheV_gdU2ZPZBvw.text: So I found this Japanese restaurant located right beside Sycamore Brewery after indulging in National IPA. The location is perfectly located in the heart of South End around the breweries and other local favorites in the area.   First off, it's perfect that I can walk to restaurant. The staff for the most part got us seated pretty quickly since it was just moderately busy. The decor is ok and the size is a bit on the smaller side, so I can see that being an issue when more people discover this place.   The waitress was pretty nice and professional, knowledgeable to the extent that she was correct.   I ordered the citrus infused sake, some berry martini drink, scallop ceviche, the Caribbean roll (on special), and a couple of other items. It all was delicious! No complaints on the taste of the food and the quality of the seafood.   All in all, I would definitely, and am, going again!  --TrizzyO_o

bSQEB3SXfTiHu1egeMdDSg.text: First I had the fresh tune appetizer, it was delicious as spicy! Great. The main specialty rolls were, the volcano roll (right) and the surf and turf roll (left). Both are good, but I love the soft and turf!!!

PiT39maMGryFs2-ouSPWNQ.text: Best sushi in Charlotte! Everything at Yamazaru is amazing. We are frequent customers and always take our out of town guest here when they want sushi. All sushi is fresh and reasonably priced. Definitely recommend!

U4m3k2HtuhEU3jKPSDKiNw.text: This place is really among  my favorites now. Recently moved to Charlotte, I am driving around looking for places and find this Japanese restaurant tucked inside a small street. As soon as I seat at the bar, Gus the bartender greets me with a smile and phenomenal sake. Points out his favorite dishes and boy was he right on point! The food was just outstanding, the service friendly and courteous. I felt like I was a regular at this place and I will from now on. Great job!

B9M8GEaN1yCs5RjfbsXcoQ.text: Damn. Wanted to be disappointed, but completely wowed. Words escape me. Absolutely fevorent attention to presentation and quality. Please don't go. It's hard enough to get a table.

8NRjuTdUdfMk41DWLI_aFA.text: I'm telling you right now, compared to any other top restaurant in Charlotte, this place has FANTASTIC customer service and ATTENTION TO DETAIL.  The manager is FANTASTIC, the bus boys are actually always busy like keeping the place very neat and tidy, and the bartender is the nicest guy you could ask for behind the bar.  I get treated like A KING when I go here and I appreciate the HELL OUT OF IT.  This restaurant has very good food but I'm telling you right now there attention to the customers is A++.  Drinks are very Maid and the calamari is . Place gets an easy 5starz.

ElqxcfT79MVpSPRBmky7XA.text: The hubs and I finally came to check this place out Saturday evening around 7:30 and thanks to rain, there was a very little wait for our table (it is a smaller restaurant). We were seated at the sushi bar, which was awesome, because watching them churn out roll after roll was a delight in itself (and helped me pick my roll). The servers were attentive and informative, but in no way rushed you to order or anything. We started with the pork gyoza, which was light yet flavorful, and the ponzu sauce had a light kick to it. My husband ordered the UFO and spicy salmon roll and I ordered the Rich & Famous and spicy tuna roll. All four of these rolls were delicious and very filling! Each had their own unique flavor profiles and my husband couldn't stop raving about his UFO roll (he's still new to eating sushi). This is definitely a place that we will be back to again and again to get our sushi fix!   Bonus - if there is a wait, they will take your number so you can hop over to Sycamore for a pre-dinner beer.

PuemnE6V5s90cu0RODGA9Q.text: This is my favorite sushi place in town. Call ahead if you have 6 or more people! They always seat us right away, service is fast, staff is super nice. The sushi and appetizers (I've had em all) are delicious! I can't recommend this place enough!
